title: [Caffe2] CUDA 9.2 and gcc 7.3.1
body_html:
Issue description

CUDA 9.2 is now listing gcc-7.3.1 in its supported compiler.
Use it for several CUDA projects, including Caffe1, and works well.

A PR is created to adjust the cmake restriction: #7880

However in Caffe2 we're getting some errors in operator headers like

GetSingleArgument is not a member of OperatorBase

Seems nvcc has some compile errors inside template function.
The same commit works with gcc-6.3.1.
Any idea?

System Info

  • PyTorch or Caffe2: Caffe2
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source): cmake
  • OS: CentOS-7
  • PyTorch version: master
  • CUDA version: 9.2
  • GPU models and configuration: 1080Ti
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): 7.3.1 from devtoolset-7
  • CMake version: 3.11.2

body:
## Issue description

CUDA 9.2 is now listing gcc-7.3.1 in its supported compiler.
Use it for several CUDA projects, including Caffe1, and works well.

A PR is created to adjust the cmake restriction: #7880 

However in Caffe2 we're getting some errors in operator headers like
```
GetSingleArgument is not a member of OperatorBase
```
Seems nvcc has some compile errors inside template function.
The same commit works with gcc-6.3.1.
Any idea?

## System Info

- PyTorch or Caffe2: Caffe2
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
- Build command you used (if compiling from source): cmake
- OS: CentOS-7
- PyTorch version: master
- CUDA version: 9.2
- GPU models and configuration: 1080Ti
- GCC version (if compiling from source): 7.3.1 from devtoolset-7
- CMake version: 3.11.2
